graph_title: Percentage of children in poverty (ward average)
indicator_definition: Monitoring national poverty is important for country-specific development agendas. National poverty lines are used to make more accurate estimates of poverty consistent with the country’s specific economic and social circumstances, and are not intended for international comparisons of poverty rates.
un_custodian_agency: United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEFF) World Bank (WB) United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
indicator_available: Percentage of children in poverty (ward average)
indicator_description: ward average percentage of children under 18 living in poverty before and after housing costs are taken into account.
computation_definitions: This dataset estimates the percentage of children living in households with below 60% median income in the local area. Housing costs here are defined as income available to a household once rent, water rates, mortgage interest payments, buildings insurance payments, ground rent and service charges are paid.
computation_calculations: No calculations were performed in the data acquisition of this indicator as appropriate data was readily available in the final format specified by this indicator.
